mainBoard.flavorText:
"Only the lion knows more stories than I do."
—Chulane, Teller of Tales
mainBoard.name: Keeper of Fables
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever one or more non-Human creatures you control deal combat damage to a player, draw a card.

rulings.text: Because creatures with first strike deal combat damage before creatures without first strike, Keeper of Fables's ability can trigger twice during one combat if your creatures deal combat damage to one player at different times.
If non-Human creatures you control deal combat damage to two or more players at the same time, Keeper of Fables's ability triggers for each of those players.
Keeper of Fables's ability triggers even if it's dealt lethal damage at the same time that non-Humans you control deal combat damage to a player.

mainBoard.text: Whenever one or more non-Human creatures you control deal combat damage to a player, draw a card.

mainBoard.name: Canopy Stalker
mainBoard.originalText:
Canopy Stalker must be blocked if able.
When Canopy Stalker dies, you gain 1 life for each creature that died this turn.

rulings.text: Canopy Stalker's triggered ability counts itself, as well as any other creatures that die before the triggered ability resolves.

If each creature the defending player controls can't block for any reason (such as being tapped), then Canopy Stalker isn't blocked. If there's a cost associated with blocking Canopy Stalker, the defending player isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to be blocked in that case either.
If your life total is brought to 0 or less at the same time that Canopy Stalker is dealt lethal damage, you lose the game before its last ability goes on the stack.
Only one creature is required to block Canopy Stalker. Other creatures may also block it, and are free to block other creatures or not block at all.
The defending player, not you, chooses which creature blocks Canopy Stalker.

mainBoard.name: Pridemalkin
mainBoard.originalText:
When Pridemalkin enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has trample. (They can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker they're attacking.)

rulings.text: Pridemalkin can be the target of its own first ability.
Pridemalkin's second ability applies to Pridemalkin as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.

mainBoard.text:

mainBoard.flavorText: For Mittens, it was just another day at the beach.
mainBoard.name: Enlarge
mainBoard.originalText: Target creature gets +7/+7 and gains trample until end of turn. It must be blocked this turn if able.

rulings.text: If each creature the defending player controls can't block for any reason (such as being tapped), then the affected creature isn't blocked. If there's a cost associated with blocking the affected creature, the defending player isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to be blocked in that case either.
Only one creature is required to block the affected creature. Other creatures may also block it and are free to block other creatures or not block at all.

mainBoard.text: Target creature gets +7/+7 and gains trample until end of turn. It must be blocked this turn if able. (A creature with trample can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)

mainBoard.flavorText: Many elves incorporate the beauty of nature into their inventions. Very few capture its savagery.
mainBoard.name: Nature's Way
mainBoard.originalText: Target creature you control gains vigilance and trample until end of turn. It deals damage equal to its power to target creature you don't control.

rulings.text: If either target is an illegal target as Nature's Way resolves, no damage will be dealt.
If the creature you don't control is an illegal target as Nature's Way tries to resolve, the creature you control will still gain vigilance and trample.
Trample only applies to the assignment of combat damage, not the damage Nature's Way has the creature deal.
You can't cast Nature's Way unless you choose both a creature you control and a creature you don't control as targets.

mainBoard.text: Target creature you control gains vigilance and trample until end of turn. It deals damage equal to its power to target creature you don't control.
